case_vignette:
A 45-year-old man comes to the emergency department with the complaint of pain and swelling of the proximal joint in the third finger of his right hand. The pain is so severe that it woke him up from sleep this morning. He has never had an episode like this before. The patient has smoked a pack of cigarettes daily for the last 25 years and drinks alcohol heavily each weekend. His friend threw a party last night where he drank 3–4 beers and was unable to drive back home. He has no past medical illness. His mother died of pancreatic cancer at age 55, and his father died of a stroke 2 years ago. His temperature is 37.7°C (100°F), blood pressure is 130/70 mm Hg, pulse is 104/min, respiratory rate is 20/min, and BMI is 25 kg/m2. The patient is in moderate distress due to the pain. On examination, the proximal interphalangeal joint of the third finger of his right hand is very tender to touch, swollen, warm, and slightly red in color. Range of motion cannot be assessed due to extreme tenderness. The patient’s right hand is shown in the image.
Laboratory investigation
Complete blood count:
Hemoglobin 14.5 g/dL
Leukocytes 16,000/mm3
Platelets 150,000/mm3
ESR     55mm/hr
Synovial fluid is aspirated from the joint. The findings are:
Appearance Cloudy, dense yellow
WBC 30,000 cells/µL
Culture Negative
Negatively birefringent needle-shaped crystals are seen.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Rheumatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have severe pain and swelling in the joint of my third finger on my right hand, and it's so bad it woke me up this morning.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
The pain started this morning; it's the first time this has happened.
Do you have similar swelling or pain in any other joints?
No, just the joint in my third finger on my right hand.
Have you had any recent injuries or infections?
No, I haven't had any injuries or infections recently.
Have you experienced any recent skin rashes, eye problems, or digestive issues?
No, I haven't had any skin rashes, eye problems, or digestive issues.
Do you have a history of psoriasis or any family history of psoriasis or psoriatic arthritis?
No, I don't have a history of psoriasis, and there is no family history of it either.
Are you currently taking any medications or have you started any new medications recently?
No, I'm not taking any medications and haven't started any new ones recently.
How old are you and what is your sex?
I'm a 45-year-old man.
Do you have any history of gout or have you been diagnosed with high uric acid levels?
I've never had an episode like this before and I have no past medical illness, so I've not been diagnosed with gout or high uric acid levels.
Do you engage in any activities that repetitively stress the joint, such as typing or playing an instrument?
No, I don't engage in activities that stress the joint repetitively.
Final Diagnosis: Acute gouty arthritis
